title: AI has potential to reduce burden on healthcare workforce: Top govt official
description: Artificial Intelligence will strengthen India's healthcare system. Union Health Secretary Punya Salila Srivastava highlighted AI's role in reducing workforce burden and enhancing patient care. India's digital health ecosystem is expanding, integrating AI into primary care. Initiatives like MadhuNetrAI and Cough Against TB are showcasing AI's potential for disease detection and early alerts.

title: AI boosting efficiency; risk of weakening human accountability a challenge
description: Artificial Intelligence promises to boost work efficiency and value creation. However, experts warn of education system gaps and the risk of reduced human accountability. Leaders from global financial institutions highlighted these concerns at the AI Impact Summit 2026. Preparing the workforce and maintaining oversight are crucial for future growth.

title: SC questions Centre about accuracy of video transcripts relied upon to detain Sonam Wangchuk
description: The bench said that in the age of artificial intelligence the precision of transcripts should be at least 98%.
content:
The Supreme Court on Monday questioned the Union government about the accuracy of transcripts of videos relied upon to detain Ladakh activist Sonam Wangchuk under the National Security Act, Bar and Bench reported.

title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: 'You'll be redundant if...,' Microsoft South Asia President explains how AI will change jobs
description: India AI Impact Summit 2026: Microsoft's Puneet Chandok said the next big shift in artificial intelligence will be the arrival of "digital colleagues" - AI agents that function as teammates rather than tools.

description: American artificial intelligence firm Anthropic on Monday announced it has opened a Bengaluru office, its second in Asia after Tokyo, and will focus on hiring local talent across a wide array of roles.

title: PM Modi explores Artificial Intelligence innovation exhibits at India AI Summit
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday toured several exhibition pavilions at the India AI Impact Expo 2026 at Bharat Mandapam, interacting with startups, researchers, and technology leaders showcasing AI applications across diverse sectors. His visit took place ahead of the official inauguration of the Expo, which runs from February 16 to 20 alongside the India AI Impact Summit 2026.
